abstract: The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the web server that was the source of the last delivered media segment.

# serverAddress

**Instance Property**

The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the web server that was the source of the last delivered media segment.

## Declaration

```swift
var serverAddress: String! { get }
```

## Movie access log event properties

- **numberOfSegmentsDownloaded**: A count of media segments downloaded from the web server to your app.
- **playbackStartDate**: The timestamp for when playback began for the movie log access event.
- **uri**: The URI of the playback item.
- **numberOfServerAddressChanges**: A count of changes to the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMovieAccessLogEvent/serverAddress] property over the last uninterrupted period of playback.
- **playbackSessionID**: A GUID that identifies the playback session to use in HTTP requests.
- **playbackStartOffset**: An offset into the playlist where the last uninterrupted period of playback began, in seconds.
- **segmentsDownloadedDuration**: The accumulated duration of the media downloaded, in seconds.
- **durationWatched**: The accumulated duration of the media played, in seconds.
- **numberOfStalls**: The total number of playback stalls encountered.
- **numberOfBytesTransferred**: The accumulated number of bytes transferred.
- **observedBitrate**: The empirical throughput across all media downloaded for the movie player, in bits per second.
- **indicatedBitrate**: The throughput required to play the stream, as advertised by the web server, in bits per second.
- **numberOfDroppedVideoFrames**: The total number of dropped video frames.
